name: AI Safety
overviewExcerpt: Mitigate catastrophic risks from advanced AI systems by working on technical alignment, governance, or strategy.
roleShapes: Technical Research: Theory, Interpretability, Model Evals. (Focus: Understanding systems).
Safety Engineering: Secure Infrastructure, Reliability, Red Teaming. (Focus: Building robust systems).
Governance & Strategy: Policy analysis, Compute Governance, International Coordination. (Focus: Governing deployment).
fitSignals: Motivated by catastrophic risk (high-stakes failure modes)
Comfortable with significant uncertainty and high abstraction

quickTaste.title: Quick taste (≈1 hour)
quickTaste.description: ## Quick taste — 1-hour overview (choose 1) - Robert Miles — “Intro to AI Safety, Remastered” (video) - DeepMind — “AGI Safety Course” playlist (video course) - The Map: “Preventing an AI-related catastrophe” (80,000 Hours)

deeperDive.title: Deeper dive (2–6 hours)
deeperDive.description: ## Deeper dive — longer exposure (choose 1) - AGI Safety Fundamentals (reading group + discussion + project) - BlueDot Impact AI courses (technical safety / governance)

handsOn.title: Hands-on trial
handsOn.description: ## Hands-on project — proof of fit - Distill a Paper: Read one seminal paper and write a summary. - The Jailbreak Test: Red-teaming exercise. - SPAR: Part-time mentorship.

jobBoard.title: Job board scan (real roles)
jobBoard.description: ## Job-board scan — job-board exploration (choose 1–2) - 80,000 Hours job board - AISafety.com jobs - Optional alt: EA Opportunities board - Tiny scanning method (10–25 min): collect 8–12 interesting roles → label…

name: Animal Welfare
overviewExcerpt: Reduce suffering at scale by reforming factory farming, developing alternative proteins, and advancing legal protections.
roleShapes: Advocacy & movement building: legal, policy, and field-building roles.
Meat alternatives: R&D, ops, strategy to displace factory farming.
Research & analysis: identifying neglected interventions and welfare metrics.
Government & institution-facing work: lobbying, procurements, standards.
fitSignals: Motivated by a strong moral desire to reduce suffering at scale (esp. billions of farmed animals).
Comfortable with some moral / tactical trade-offs (e.g., 'corporate engagement vs total abolition').
You value evidence and cost-effectiveness (which interventions do the most good per $ or hour).

quickTaste.title: Quick taste (≈1 hour)
quickTaste.description: ## Quick taste — 1-hour overview (choose 1) - 80,000 Hours — Factory farming problem profile (skim; strong EA-style overview) - “Intro to effective animal advocacy” — Jacy Reese (video)

deeperDive.title: Deeper dive (2–6 hours)
deeperDive.description: ## Deeper dive — longer exposure (choose 1) - Animal Advocacy Careers — Intro Course. - 80,000 Hours podcast (e.g. Lewis Bollard).

handsOn.title: Hands-on trial
handsOn.description: ## Hands-on project — proof of fit - Volunteer: Faunalytics / Animal Advocacy Careers (2-5h/week). - The Donation Pitch: Write a 1-page effectiveness brief.

jobBoard.title: Job board scan (real roles)
jobBoard.description: ## Job-board scan — make it concrete - Scan: Animal Advocacy Careers or 80,000 Hours. - Exercise: Role Clustering (Building vs Strategy).

name: Animal x AI
overviewExcerpt: Leverage AI to reduce animal suffering at scale—from monitoring wild populations to optimizing advocacy—while mitigating risks like automated factory farming.
roleShapes: Applied ML for Wild Animals: Monitoring populations, acoustic detection, and conflict mitigation.
AI in Farmed Systems: Interventions in agriculture/aquaculture to ensure AI improves welfare.
Advocacy Tech: LLM workflows, message testing, and ops automation for animal organizations.
Research & Strategy: Mapping risks and identifying high-leverage AI applications.
fitSignals: You like concrete technical leverage (data/ML) and you're motivated by animals.
You're comfortable with 'applied + messy' domains (datasets, field conditions, imperfect metrics).
You can hold a balanced stance: 'AI can help' and 'AI can harm if used carelessly.'

quickTaste.title: Quick taste (≈1 hour)
quickTaste.description: ## Quick taste — 1-hour overview (choose 1) - ACE: “Impacts of AI on animal advocacy” (strategic overview). - Rethink Priorities: “AI for human–wildlife conflict” (concrete example). - Faunalytics: “AI and Animal Advocacy” (adoption status).

deeperDive.title: Deeper dive (2–6 hours)
deeperDive.description: ## Deeper dive — longer exposure (choose 1) - Fellowships: AI×Animals (Standard) or Futurekind (Project-based). - Research Series: Rethink Priorities (Aquatic Animals).

handsOn.title: Hands-on trial
handsOn.description: ## Hands-on project — proof of fit - Volunteer: Felidae (ML for conservation) or Faunalytics (Research tooling). - Scoping Note: Write a deliverable for an org.

jobBoard.title: Job board scan (real roles)
jobBoard.description: ## Job-board scan — make it concrete - Scan: Animal Advocacy Careers (field-specific) or 80k. - Exercise: Role Clustering.

name: Biosecurity / Pandemic preparedness
overviewExcerpt: Prevent catastrophic pandemics—natural or engineered—through better early detection, safer biotechnology, and stronger policy.
roleShapes: Public health security & policy: strategy, regulation, and international coordination.
Technical work: biosurveillance, diagnostics, PPE, and far-UVC engineering.
Research & analysis: risk assessment, program evaluation, epidemiology modeling.
Ops & programs: running biosecurity initiatives, coordination, grantmaking ops.
fitSignals: Motivated by preparedness + systems thinking (institutions, incentives, coordination)
Comfortable with policy/bureaucracy and/or technical public health work
Often benefits from 'make it concrete' steps (projects, job-board scan), because the space can feel abstract

quickTaste.title: Quick taste (≈1 hour)
quickTaste.description: ## Quick taste — 1-hour overview (choose 1) - 80,000 Hours Biorisk research, strategy & policy career review (read/skim as an overview entry point). 80,000 Hours - YouTube talk (EA-context): Jaime Yassif (biosecurity /…

deeperDive.title: Deeper dive (2–6 hours)
deeperDive.description: ## Deeper dive — longer exposure (choose 1) - BlueDot Impact — Biosecurity course (structured ~30h exposure). BlueDot+1 - Optional alt: pick 1–2 episodes/articles from 80,000 Hours’ biosecurity materials for deeper…

handsOn.title: Hands-on trial
handsOn.description: ## Hands-on project — proof of fit - Volunteer (projects): Oxford Biosecurity Group. - Volunteer (hunt): Find roles on EA Opps Board.

jobBoard.title: Job board scan (real roles)
jobBoard.description: ## Job-board scan — make it concrete - Scan: 80,000 Hours or EA Opps. - Exercise: Role Clustering (Tech vs Policy vs Ops).

name: Climate
overviewExcerpt: Rapidly reduce greenhouse gas emissions (and support adaptation where it's most valuable) by pushing on the highest-leverage bottlenecks: policy, clean energy deployment, targeted innovation, and (in some cases) carbon removal.
roleShapes: Policy / government / regulation (often very leveraged; hard to attribute impact, but can be huge).
Climate-focused engineering / tech (clean power, industrial decarbonization, storage, etc.).
Research (climate science, modelling, carbon removal R&D, or 'what actually works' analysis).
Advocacy / communications (especially around 'neglected-but-effective' interventions).
Climate finance / impact investing (moving large sums can matter; also easy to do 'busy work,' so select carefully).
Community / field-building (helping others enter or coordinate effectively).
fitSignals: You're willing to be a bit strategic (choosing which slice of climate to push on, not just 'anything climate').
You can tolerate imperfect feedback loops (policy + systems change can be slow and hard to measure).
You like high-leverage work: 'one decision / one institution -> very large downstream effects.'

name: Global Health & Development
overviewExcerpt: Reduce large-scale suffering and premature death by scaling interventions that are cheap, evidence-backed, and logistically feasible (e.g., malaria prevention/treatment, vaccinations, nutrition).
roleShapes: Program implementation & field ops (distribution, logistics, monitoring)
Research & evaluation (development econ, epidemiology, cost-effectiveness, RCTs)
Grantmaking / philanthropy (moving money well; vetting)
Policy and government implementation (health systems, procurement, public finance)
Entrepreneurship / founding new orgs (esp. 'evidence-to-scale' nonprofits)
fitSignals: You're motivated by measurable impact and are OK with 'unsexy' operational realities (supply chains, compliance, systems)
You like working with messy real-world constraints and still making steady progress
You enjoy evidence and tradeoffs (not only 'what's morally urgent' but also 'what works')
